page.title: 04Mortimer Fire Station
page.content: The Fire Brigade, renamed Royal Berkshire Fire and Rescue Service (1985) is stationed in West End Rd by Dad's Shop (since 1974) and consists of 10 retained firemen, including a baronet. The old station in The Street is now used as a G.P.O. Sorting Office. Firemen wear yellow light weight helmets, fire proof winter tunics (Â£80), yellow waterproof leggings and steel protected safety boots. 6 men (maximum) go out each time. It takes 4 years to train a fireman. There are about 25 calls in a quiet month. Peak times are in October (chimney fires) and in dry summers. In last years drought firemen regularly watered young trees on the fairground. This year the Fire Brigade is sharing organisation of the Mortimer Horse Show(for National Benevolent Fund) with Mortimer Cricket Club.
